result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sou Thao

records.addlTxt:
1:58 PM Defendant Sou Thao not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State requests warrant for Defendant failing to appear for Court. 
Court reviews the criminal complaint for probable cause. 
Court finds there is probable cause and grants the request for warrant.

BY THE COURT:
*  Warrant - body only - statewide

3:06 PM Defendant Sou Thao in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions the Defendant.
Defendant states he contacted the public defender office and haven't heard anything yet.
BY THE COURT: Bond is continued
Initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash Bond posted on 07/28/22:
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

2:46 PM Defendant Sou Thao in court.  Attorney Jedidiah Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant appears without counsel.
Defendant would like to have counsel.
Court questions if he has contacted the public defender's office - he has in Wausau.
Defendant is informed to get in contact with the public defender in Portage County.
If not eligible for public defender then can petition the court for a court appointed attorney.
Defendant has not received a copy of the criminal complaint.
ADA Dodge provides the defendant with a copy of the complaint.
Defendant would like counsel.
ADA Dodge would request to add conditions to the $500 cash bond.

BY THE COURT: 
Case to be adjourned.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Initial appearance on August 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Warrant Paperwork Returned from the Sheriff's Dept.
**$500 Cash Alternative paid in Marathon County on 07/22/22**

2:27 PM Defendant Sou Thao not in court.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State requests warrant for Defendant failing to appear for Court. 
State would request a warrant.
Court questions the State for proper service. 
Summons had been sent to the last known address for the defendant.
State informs the Court there was proper service. 
Court reviews the criminal complaint for probable cause. 
Court finds there is probable cause and grants the request for warrant.

BY THE COURT:
*  Warrant with $500 cash alternative - adjacent counties
Initial Appearance set for June 6, 2022 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 1
